WORSHIP.title: Artistry
WORSHIP.about: Much love and big respect to James at Harsh Noise Wall Bandcamp for asking me to make something for him. I am truly honoured to be amongst great crafters of the HNW style here:  harshnoisewall.bandcamp.com
WORSHIP.credits:
released April 28, 2023
Thank you so much, Roger at Musique Machine!
"Artistry features two progressing & developing examples of the wall noise form. With Worship once again shows a talent for subtle creativity within the boundaries of the genre. It’s great to see the project spreading its wings beyond its normal self-released output, and I hope this continues more as more people need to hear this project's work."
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=9734

I know this is not the first Christy Turlington album amongst noise cricles, but she has long since been an inspiration and obsession of mine so it felt like this tribute to the most beautiful super human would come for WORSHIP eventually.
Your download comes with 34 images of the goddess Christy Turlington.

WORSHIP.title: COVEN (*v*)
WORSHIP.about:
COVEN is a 102 minute collection of tracks either previously released on compilations, or new sounds made for this release.
'Everything' has been expanded from 42 seconds to 15 minutes.
'Ecstasy' was available on tape but not online.
'void' is a 30 minute no change wall made for COVEN.
The download comes with all the pictures and a video for Demon Kitten.
WORSHIP.credits:
released June 6, 2022
Click into each track for the links to the original releases.
Thank you to Anonim-Noise, Razorwire Handcuffs, Hot Fuzz / Black Cats Are Evil, Camembert Electrique, Misanthropic Vendetta, godNOISEgod, Owlripper Recordings, Vomir, The Owl and mima kass for their involvement and opportunities that led to creating the sounds on this collection, and to you for looking, listening, supporting, WORSHIPPING!

WORSHIP.title: Erosu
WORSHIP.about:
Do you still love me?
As all that surrounds crumbles,
the heat climbs enough to burn.
Eyes never once flicker from gaze.
Do you still desire me?
Wrap me around your mind.
Ache for me at every moment
and experience true worship.

WORSHIP.title: EXPECTATION
WORSHIP.about:
Much love and respect to David, Stemms Audio for sharing 'Expectation'.
stemmstapes.bandcamp.com
www.instagram.com/stemms_audio
'I am beyond ecstatic to present the latest release form the mighty WORSHIP. 2 new HNW's from one of the current forward thinking pioneers of the genre. Crushing, numbing and brilliant.'
WORSHIP.credits:
released February 21, 2023
More love and admiration to Roger at Musique Machine for more words.
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=9627
Expectation is another rewarding two-track release from Worship, with both tracks highlighting the project's talent for trying something different. Oh, and it’s interesting to see more openly sexual track titles being used- for the first time in Worship's releases."
"It’s a clever, if at times slightly mentally frustrating ‘wall’ that really rewards more focused listening. Both are decidedly creative takes on this most extreme of sound forms.

WORSHIP.title: EXPLOSIONS
WORSHIP.about:
Come with me
until the sweet end
Nigh is our time
So let's celebrate
Enraptured
Erupting
Close those eyes
and come with me.
I need you now more than ever.

WORSHIP.title: FERNANDE
WORSHIP.about:
50 Minutes.
3 Walls.
15 pictures of cover girl Fernande Barrey included in the download.
Thank you Yann and Camembert Electrique for the release, guidance and beautiful words about this record.
camembertelectrique.bandcamp.com
www.instagram.com/camembertelectrique_
"Mood Swinger" is very beautiful and very successful, because once our ears get used to the noise sound, we discover behind dark ambient parts.
"Le boudoir" is more difficult to access, but the same behind the storm, we hear small heady samples. It is a track to listen with closed eyes to discover the different variations. It is clear that there is something going on behind this wall!
"Joyeuse Fin" is similar to the beginning track: a very dark ambient and Science Fiction atmosphere. We are attracted to great intergalactic spaces. The wall of noise lets us once again guess some more subtle ambiences behind.

WORSHIP.title: FOCUS
WORSHIP.about:
I am deeply honoured to say that 'FOCUS' is in Roger from Musique Machine's Top 5 Albums Of The Year. You can see the full list here -
www.musiquemachine.com/articles/articles_template.php?id=596
He also reviewed it with some lovely words here -  www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=10004
"one feels like you have been engulfed by some vast piece of chopping, rolling, and churning machinery"
"haunting almost harmonic mid-ranged drone, and from time to time we can make out the skittering ‘n’ hazed hoover."
"Focus is yet another highly skilled & creative take on the walled / textured noise genre. With the looped, but building industrial-toned elements rather bringing to mind Aube’s work with chains & metallic elements".

WORSHIP.title: I Give You My Everything
WORSHIP.credits:
released August 1, 2024
Much love many times over to Roger at Musique Machine.
'We open in a nice dark atmosphere-building vibe..'
'..great low-end creeping hovers & almost explosive rolling tone hits.'
'..a series of spaced-out textural spins'
'..great feeling of growing airless tension and low-key unease.'
'I Give You Everything shows Worship expanding (their!) work beyond the formal bounds of walled noise, into something more distinctive and difficult to fully define. Another fine release from the project, and great to hear about its growth/ progression.'
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=10671
Thank you Spectrasonic Sound for playing 'Addictive Aroma'
www.mixcloud.com/spectrasonicsound/the-institute-of-spectra-sonic-sound-92124/

WORSHIP.title: RUBY
WORSHIP.about:
The cover model is Clara Ruby-Black.This album is intended to be more aligned with earlier WORSHIP albums in its simplicity and innocence.
Thank you Musique Machine for beautiful words about this one. A few highlights here:
"Ruby features two examples of pummelling, yet cosily encasing wall-craft from Worship
“Cherry”, The ‘wall’ feels akin to watching an evenly blowing sheet, or maybe a boat sail on a slightly warming summer's day. Though the ‘wall’ is persistently battering in it’s flow, there is something rather comfy and soothingly enchanting about the whole thing.
“Return To Innocence”, For this ‘wall’ I’m getting images of being slowly hit around the head with multiple pillows. The whole thing features a most effective feeling of gently slowing, with at points you thinking the whole thing will grind to a stop- but of course it never does, as it’s just a trick of the ‘wall’.
Ruby takes in two rewardingly examples of the wall-noise, and I particularly enjoy the feeling of comfy battering, which both of them have in their structure/ textural flow. With the 1920’s model theme nicely fitting the ‘walls’ vibe/ feel very well."
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=9077

WORSHIP.credits:
released March 15, 2022
Many thanks to Musique Machine for wonderful words, the abridged version here:
“Banished” - locked down blend of this throbbing-sort-of droning low end, a sightly rumble bound static grained judder, and a low key/ ominous billow. Together these elements create a densely encasing wall, which has a nice shadowy brooding undercurrent running through its sonic marrow
“Nightbird” - This ‘wall’ has a more urgent, yet still decidedly ominous and oppressive feel to its attack- and once again I’m getting quite a set industrial feeling to both elements here.
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=8950

WORSHIP.title: SYMMETRY
WORSHIP.about:
The near-perfect symmetry on this picture is astonishing.
Read the picture left to right over the course of 20 minutes. 'Sharp Edge' attempts to reflect the finer details of the picture, with the sharpest peak of it being in the centre at 10:00
Much love to all who stare at the sword.

anonim-noise.bandcamp.com

WORSHIP.title: THE GROUND
WORSHIP.about: Cover and 5 bonus related nature images in the download.

WORSHIP.title: THE STARE
WORSHIP.about:
Thank you Musique Machine once more for very nice words: (abridged text here)
“Don’t Look Away” - buffeting ‘n’ baying rumble surrounded by a growing selection of rattling ‘n’ shaking sub-tones, with the thickness of the whole thing growing fast. Throughout the ‘wall’ retains an uncertain feeling, which I guess nicely works with the theme of being in the company of someone unpredictable, possible unbalanced who is just staring at you.
“Deadly” - slowly glowing web of sub-tones, which take in purred rattles, constantly rolling spins, and focused shaking.
Once again, The Stare finds Worship trying to do something a little different, and interestingly themed within the ‘wall-noise’, without stepping too far out of the restraints of the genre- which is a difficult thing to do. This is certainly a project to keep an eye on!
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=9238

WORSHIP.title: THOUGHTS
WORSHIP.about:
Thank you to LOUDsilence for originally releasing this album on February 3rd, 2024, describing it as 'Pure harsh noise wall textures + deep sensual drone meditations'.
loudsilencedigital.bandcamp.com/album/lsd20-thoughts
www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pfys_KG0N4
'Sound vibrations to hold against your body for a physical experience'
WORSHIP.credits:
released March 15, 2024
Much love as always to Roger of Musique Machine for another review!
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=10363
"Worship started out as a straight-walled noise venture- but Thoughts has pushed more drone / experimental elements. “Warm” feels weightily compressing, and soothing- with the whole thing feeling akin to snuggling your face into a huge warm mound- be it flesh, cushions, or linen. “Deep” is excellent, and you really do get sucked in/ hypnotized by the wall Worship has created. Thoughts is another well-conceived and engaging release from Worship".

WORSHIP.title: WHIRR
WORSHIP.about:
Thank you Musique Machine for wonderful words about this album. Here is an abridged version below:
WHIRR severs us up two just over half-hour slices of walled noise craft from the decidedly mysterious Worship. The project theme all of their releases around the naked female form, and often add in quite creative tendencies to their work.
“Purr”. The title is very apt, as the wall is built around a tight, taut and slightly beaded bass purr-which edged by a controlled buffeting ‘n’ baying tone. The whole thing has a wonderful sense of thick bass-bound hover, which seems to be buzzy and lightly caresses your sonic sensors.
“Headspin”: a most fitting title. The ‘wall’ has a decidedly warped quality- The layers seem to bleed ‘n’ blend into one another in a most wonkily appealing manner- you try to keep following the patterns, but your minds constantly grabbing at their tails as the whole thing seems to warp more and more….but as always with walled noise, this could all be a trick of the ‘wall’.
One of the most interesting/ consistent wall noise projects to appear in the last few years.
www.musiquemachine.com/reviews/reviews_template.php?id=9308
